revised_title: Parasite and Host Interactions in the Loranthaceae: Observations on Viscum and Korthalsella
tldr: This article examines the modes of union and interaction between parasites and their hosts in the Loranthaceae family, focusing on Viscum and Korthalsella species. The author investigates the effects of sinkers (structures formed by parasites) on host xylem elements and describes the various ways in which the parasites interact with their hosts, including the control of differentiation in the host wood and the formation of galls.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
